reviews.text: Overall this is a very nice hotel with good service. The rooms are clean and comfortable and location is good for highway access, town centre and shopping mall. The breakfast quality could be improved.
reviews.title: business meeting rOSWELL

reviews.text: Everyone at hotel excelled in treating you like you were their only concern checkin and
reviews.title: October stay

reviews.text: Young hispanic girl (Mona???) at the desk was the only interaction i had with staff. She was very professional and helpful with directions and ammentities. Definitely recommend this hotel and wont hesitate to stay here in the future.
reviews.title: Glad to get a good rate during the week

reviews.text: I've stayed in this area, at a variety of properties, numerous times, both on the weekends and during the week. Rates are incredibly cheaper during the weekends, and many of the properties are completely booked during the week. I found the Wingate to be decent and comfortable, though I wouldn't stay here on the weekends when there were other, higher-end affordable options. It's possible that I got one of the older rooms, although I paid slightly more for a "deluxe" room since the standard rooms were sold out. Bathroom could have been cleaned better, pillows were over-stuffed and uncomfortable, but I do like the way the beds are made so that the duvet is covered by laundered sheets. I booked the first night through a third party, and was pleased that, when I had to stay a second night, the hotel staff was able to give me a good discount.
reviews.title: Awesome Wingate

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located. The staff is friendly. They remember me from previous stays. Rooms are clean and larger than typical in this price range. Some rooms are more updated than others. Older rooms need a redo.
reviews.title: Good value. Helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel. Need more signs off GA 400 to help find it. Excellent breakfast. Only problem was hotel keys quit working after first use probably caused by bad batteries in door. Loved nice soft bed and front desk person was very helpful with opening of cans of soup.
reviews.title: Hospital Trip

reviews.text: Horrible. I expected better service sonce our first stay turned out bad...I'd rather pay a lot more for Holiday Inn..
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: Great value. My room was very clean and substantially larger than what I expected for the cost. Complementary breakfast. Professional service from check-in to check-out. The hotel is located on exit 8 off of GA 400 and is just 2 minutes off the exit. I times our trip from the hotel to 285 (Perimeter Mall) to be 7-8 minutes. GA 400 provides direct access to downtown Atlanta in approximately 15 - 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Exceptionally clean hotel and rooms were immaculate!

reviews.text: Excellent selection of restaurants and shopping within 5 mi utes of the hotel.
reviews.title: Served the purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented this hotel on our way to and from Florida for our honeymoon. I was not impressed at all. The front desk attendent was nice. The room smelled like a stinky foot BOTH nights we stayed there. One of the nights, the bathroom wasn't fully cleaned. The breakfast selection was okay. I was upset because I found a hair that was inside of my omlet so I never ate it. I thought $50 was a good deal, but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for....

reviews.text: This is an excellent place to stay...for both the price and the accomodations. It's a very clean facility and the room we had was very comfortable. It had a desk, chair, couch, microwave and a small refrigerator. Earlier in the week, we stayed at the Hilton in Marietta and paid around $100 more per night and the room was not as nice there as the one here at Wyndham. It also had a nice complimentary breakfast bar and was conveniently located. Would definitely stay here again when we visit this area.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: I arrived to a dingy, out of date, smelly hotel. I was greeted by a rambling desk attendant... He got my info and sent me to my room. I put me key into the door and when I opened the door I surprised a lady! I just walked into her room! I went down to the front desk and informed Bryan (desk attendant) what happened. He kind of apologized and offered to give me a movie on the house- seriously, that makes this ok? He then tells me he doesnt have a king size room available (even though thats what I reserved). I then get a key to my new room (it has two queens) and I head up... as I get off the elevator (right by my new room) I see a man walking into my room! Serioulsy he has given me another occupied room! By this point I am totally freaked out and unwilling to stay at this hotel. I have to go deal with Bryan at the front desk again and cancel my room. Now I am stuck in a city with no hotel and I have to take more time to try to locate one with availability in the area. Not cool! This really scared me-- the fact that he gave me a key to someone else's room TWICE is so scary!! I will NEVER return to a Wingate/Wyndham property!
reviews.title: Scared!

reviews.text: We were really looking forward to our stay here and thought that it was great to get a Wingate hotel for the price of some of the less expensive brands in the Wyndham chain. I must say that the front desk was excellent and gave us some extra help. We had two rooms and my mother needed to check in early because she wasn't going with us for the day. They were very accommodating. My mother's room seemed pretty clean and she didn't have any complaints, which was good. If just rating on her experience, I would give the hotel a rating of 5. However, our room had a dirty sheer drape that had something spilled on it, a large area, you couldn't miss it. Also, one of our bed sheets looked like it had blood on it and we needed to do a flush of the toilet when we came in. Other than that things looked fairly clean, but possibly could use a little sprucing up. I was surprised that the room didn't have any granite counters, which is more updated. However, their all white cultured marble look in the bathrooms did have a nice, clean look to it. We had problems getting ice around Midnight and after checking all the ice machines, some weren't working, I went to the front desk person, and he went into the breakfast kitchen and got some for us. Their breakfast was the best of our trip, after staying at 3 other hotels. The variety and taste of the breakfast items was good and there were several hot choices. Check in and check out were smooth.
reviews.title: Could've been better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it was a great rate, but this hotel has lots of problems. It may be non-smoking now, but the smell of smoke is everywhere. While the decor was nice, the furniture looks like it might fall apart at any time. We were on the 3rd floor and a sign said vending and ice. The ice machine wasn't working and there were no vending machines. My husband called down to the desk to ask if some ice could be brought up but the person at the check in desk said he couldn't leave since he was the only one there. This is after telling us upon checking in to just call 0 if we needed anything. Obviously he didn't really mean it.
reviews.title: Won't stay here again

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel because it is convenient and the price is great, compared to others in the area. The staff are really friendly, but in the two separate stays at this hotel my room has had a musty smell. A relative stayed at the hotel and did not have the same smell to his room. Both visits my room faced the parking lot out front and it looked like there were some seal issues on the window which may have lead to the odor. My relatives room did not face the front of the hotel - so not sure if there is a correlation or if I have just been unlucky. Next time I will say something upon check in if it is the same.
reviews.title: Musty Rooms

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of the location and price/value. I wasn't expecting much for the price I paid, just a clean, safe and comfortable place... however, as soon as I walked into the room I was overwhelmed by a strong mildew smell that seemed to carry in the other rooms of my travel companions. Also, the hotel hot tub was out of order which was a selling point for me, and therefore added disappointment. So, even with my expectations of getting an "average" room for $100, I felt like I paid too much.
reviews.title: Musty and Underwhelming
Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Services!
reviews.text: Wow. I honestly thought that the previous comment had somehow been improperly entered because after my stay I could not put that review and this hotel "together". Our stay was quite different!

reviews.title: terrible!!
reviews.text: Pros: the location is a very short drive to the mall and close to Hwy 9 in Alpharetta. There are many good restaurants within 2 miles including Killer Creek, Pappadeaus, On the Border, Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, Buca di Peppo, and many many others. The people who work at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. They went out of their way to help us with faxing, which I don't do very often. The Business Center is excellent and totally free - even printing from the computer. The rooms were clean and nice and though they had a slight moist smell I would expect that in an area that is humid. Parking was free and convenient and the hotel is set back off of the road so there was no road noise - very quiet. The breakfast was good - hot food choices as well as the usual cereals, bagels, etc. The eating area is attractive, clean, and spacious, and there is a big screen tv for catching up on the news.
